origin_history: Vernalized the garlic for 6 weeks prior to planting.
Planted in mid-November 2025 in black planter 23.5" × 7.85" × 6" right section
Shared with Siberian Hardneck, Music Hardneck, and Scallions.
whats_been_logged: Early Chesnok Red emergence showed strong shoot growth in moist soil with low but improving pH. Lime application helped correct acidity, and a competing scallion near one sprout was identified for relocation to prevent crowding. Multiple shoots have emerged vigorously with upright green leaves as moisture and pH conditions stabilized.
current_stage: Early top growth (shoots 1–3 inches above soil)
current_state: Multiple Chesnok Red shoots are up and growing strongly with upright green leaves and only mild soil acidity remaining after planned lime application and careful watering. A competing scallion near one sprout has been identified for relocation to prevent crowding.

journal.conditions: Sunny with a high of 82°F dropping to 66°F overnight.
journal.observations: The garlic plants remain upright and structurally sound with firm bases and active inner growth. Several older, lower leaves show yellowing and browning beginning at the tips, while newer leaves remain green. No signs of rot, pest damage, or crown collapse are visible.
journal.actions: Do not water today as soil moisture is ideal. Leave yellowing leaves in place unless they are fully brown and dry. Trim only completely dead leaves at the base if desired for cleanliness.
journal.next_steps: Monitor leaf color progression over the next 3–5 days. Recheck probe readings in 2–3 days to confirm fertility trends. Consider light feeding only if yellowing advances into newer leaves.
journal.q_and_a_summary: Discussed whether yellowing and browning leaves are concerning; explained this is normal older-leaf senescence combined with mild nutrient drawdown in container-grown garlic.

photos.caption: Overhead view showing multiple garlic shoots with older outer leaves yellowing and newer inner leaves remaining green and upright.
Side view of garlic plants showing firm stems, intact crowns, and browning of the lowest leaf tips without signs of rot or pest damage.

journal.conditions: Patchy fog before 8 AM, otherwise partly sunny with a high near 84°F dropping to around 61°F overnight.
journal.observations: Chesnok Red Hardneck garlic shows vigorous vegetative growth with long, strap-like green leaves that naturally arch and drape as they confirm active elongation. Leaf bases are thick and upright, and soil is evenly moist with good structure and no signs of stress.
journal.actions: Do not water, fertilize, or adjust pH today. Allow leaves to grow and arch naturally without intervention.
journal.next_steps: Monitor moisture over the next 2–3 days as warm, sunny weather continues. Plan to water only if moisture readings fall below 40.00 mS/cm or leaves lose firmness.
journal.q_and_a_summary: Discussed whether flopping leaves are concerning; confirmed this is normal behavior during active garlic leaf elongation.

photos.caption: Overhead view of Chesnok Red garlic showing long, arching strap-like leaves and evenly moist soil, consistent with healthy vegetative growth.

journal.conditions: Partly sunny with a high of 83°F dropping to 67°F overnight.
journal.observations: Chesnok Red Hardneck garlic shows established growth with long, strap-like green leaves and strong, supported crowns. Soil is evenly moist and settled following intermittent morning rainfall, with no signs of pooling or stress.
journal.actions: Do not water, fertilize, or adjust pH today. Allow soil moisture to begin a natural dry-down under warm afternoon conditions.
journal.next_steps: Recheck moisture in 2–3 days or after the next rain event. Resume watering only if moisture readings fall below 40.00 mS/cm.
follow_up: [5:45 AM – 8:30 AM] Intermittent rain occurred, ranging from drizzle to heavier showers, naturally rehydrating the planter.

journal.actions: Do not water, fertilize, or adjust pH today. Allow soil moisture to continue stabilizing naturally with upcoming weather.
journal.next_steps: Recheck moisture in 2–3 days or after the next rain event. Resume watering only if readings fall below 40.00 mS/cm.

journal.observations: Chesnok Red Hardneck garlic shows strong, strap-like green leaves with thickened bases and no signs of stress. Soil surface appears freshly leveled and evenly moist after filling probe holes, with plants remaining upright and vigorous despite windy conditions.
journal.actions: Do not water today. Do not fertilize or adjust pH. Allow soil moisture to continue drying naturally under breezy conditions.
journal.next_steps: Recheck moisture in 2–3 days once wind subsides. Resume watering only when moisture readings fall below 40.00 mS/cm.

journal.conditions: Showers likely with a high of 81°F dropping to 63°F overnight.
journal.observations: Chesnok Red Hardneck garlic shows long, flexible, strap-like green leaves with strong bases and no signs of stress. Soil is evenly dark and fully saturated following recent watering and rainfall, with no visible pooling or stem softening.
journal.actions: Do not water today or tomorrow. Do not fertilize or adjust pH. Allow the soil to dry naturally under current weather conditions.
journal.next_steps: Recheck moisture in 2–3 days once rain passes. Resume watering only when readings fall below 40.00 mS/cm and the soil surface lightens in color.

journal.conditions: Mostly sunny with a high of 79°F dropping to 62°F overnight.
journal.observations: Chesnok Red Hardneck garlic shows healthy, upright, flexible green blades with normal arching from leaf elongation and no visible stress. The soil surface appears genuinely dry, matching the low moisture reading taken today.
journal.actions: Do not water again today. Do not fertilize or adjust pH. Leave all foliage intact and allow moisture to redistribute through the root zone naturally.
journal.next_steps: Recheck moisture tomorrow morning. Water only if moisture remains below 40.00 mS/cm or leaf firmness begins to soften. Continue watching for steady new blade extension over the next several days.

journal.conditions: Mostly Sunny with a high of 73°F dropping to 53°F overnight.
journal.observations: Chesnok Red Hardneck garlic shows healthy, flexible vegetative growth with long green blades and no signs of stress. Leaf arching reflects normal expansion rather than wilting. Soil moisture is balanced and stable, and overall plant posture remains firm. A slight upward drift in pH is observed but shows no associated visual symptoms and is consistent with recent soil disturbance and amendment integration.
journal.actions: Do not water today. Do not adjust pH or add amendments. Leave foliage intact and allow the soil to continue settling naturally under current conditions.
journal.next_steps: Recheck moisture and pH in 1–2 days, ideally mid-morning. Expect moisture to drift toward the mid-40s as temperatures remain mild. Continue monitoring leaf firmness and growth pattern.
journal.q_and_a_summary: User asked whether current temperatures were concerning; confirmed that daytime highs in the 70s with overnight lows in the low 50s are ideal for winter garlic and not a cause for concern.

photos.caption: Chesnok Red garlic with long, flexible green blades showing normal vegetative expansion in late afternoon light.

journal.conditions: Mostly Sunny with a high of 77°F dropping to 52°F overnight.
journal.observations: Chesnok Red Hardneck garlic shows strong upright growth with turgid, evenly green leaves and no signs of stress. Soil moisture is moderately high and stable after recent cool weather, and pH has returned to the normal range after yesterday’s temporary spike caused by contact with an amendment pocket. The soil appears well-aerated and evenly textured, reflecting the improvements from prior loosening and mixing. Overall, the plant is in excellent early winter condition.
journal.actions: Do not water today. Avoid fertilizer or soil amendments. Maintain current sunlight exposure and allow the soil to dry gradually under the mild temperatures.
journal.next_steps: Recheck moisture in 1–2 days as temperatures remain cool. Water only when readings fall below ~40 mS/cm and leaf firmness begins to soften. Continue monitoring foliage density and overall vigor as winter growth strengthens.

photos.caption: Chesnok Red garlic with upright, healthy leaves under cool morning sunlight, showing even moisture levels and a well-aerated soil surface.

journal.conditions: Slight Chance T-storms then Showers Likely with a high of 83°F dropping to 63°F overnight.
journal.observations: Chesnok Red Hardneck garlic shows upright, turgid, and uniformly green blades with no symptoms of alkaline stress despite an outlier pH reading of 8.89. Soil structure appears improved after fluffing and adding Miracle-Gro Moisture Control Potting Mix, reducing compaction and smoothing the probe hole. The moisture level is moderate and stable, and all other readings fall within normal safe ranges. The elevated pH is most consistent with probe contact on a lime pocket or freshly amended soil rather than true root-zone alkalinity.
journal.actions: Do not adjust pH or fertilize today. Avoid disturbing the soil further and allow the newly added potting mix to settle naturally. Do not water, as incoming rain will maintain adequate moisture.
journal.next_steps: Recheck moisture and pH tomorrow midday once the soil equilibrates after rain and the amendment settles. Expect pH to normalize into the typical range. Monitor leaf posture for any unexpected softening or discoloration.

photos.caption: Chesnok Red garlic with firm upright blades and freshly loosened soil after adding Miracle-Gro Moisture Control Potting Mix.

journal.conditions: Slight Chance T-storms then Showers Likely with a high of 83°F dropping to 63°F overnight.
journal.observations: Chesnok Red Hardneck garlic shows vigorous, upright growth with firm green blades and no signs of stress. The soil is evenly moist, matching the mid-range moisture reading. A slight rise in salt and fertility levels is expected following rehydration and remains well within a safe range. Leaf posture indicates ideal hydration with no signs of overwatering or nutrient imbalance.
journal.actions: Do not water today. Avoid fertilizing or adjusting pH. Allow incoming rain and natural evaporation to manage moisture levels.
journal.next_steps: Recheck moisture tomorrow late morning or early afternoon once rains pass. Water only when moisture readings fall below ~40 mS/cm and leaf firmness softens.

photos.caption: Chesnok Red garlic showing upright, turgid blades and evenly moist soil following rehydration.

journal.conditions: Patchy morning fog followed by sunny conditions with a high near 86°F. Light south wind 5–8 mph. Overnight low expected around 66°F.
journal.observations: Garlic shows strong upright growth with firm, green leaves and no signs of drought stress, despite the probe reading 0 moisture. The S-06 reading reflects a dry surface layer rather than true root-zone dryness. Plant posture indicates adequate hydration.
journal.actions: Do not water today. Moisture at the root zone remains sufficient. No fertilizer, pH adjustment, or treatments needed.
journal.next_steps: Check moisture again tomorrow late morning. Water only when mid-day moisture readings fall into the low 40s or below, or if plant posture begins to soften.
journal.q_and_a_summary: User asked whether watering was needed given probe dryness and warm, sunny weather. Confirmed that watering is not needed because the reading reflects surface dryness only and the plant shows no signs of dehydration.

photos.caption: Chesnok Red Hardneck garlic with upright, healthy leaves and no sign of drought stress even as the topsoil appears dry.

journal.conditions: Mostly sunny with a high of 84°F dropping to 64°F overnight. Soil was bone-dry by 2:00 PM; user watered and took readings approximately 2 hours later.
journal.observations: Chesnok Red Hardneck shows vigorous upright growth with deep green leaves and strong posture. The earlier bone-dry conditions were corrected by watering, and the post-watering probe reading reflects localized saturation rather than overall soil waterlogging. No signs of stress, disease, or nutrient imbalance are visible.
journal.actions: Do not water again today. Allow the soil to redistribute moisture naturally overnight. No fertilizer, pH adjustment, or treatments needed.
journal.next_steps: Expect moisture to settle into the mid-range by tomorrow morning. Continue monitoring leaf firmness and growth direction. Water next when mid-day moisture readings fall below ~40–45 mS/cm.

photos.caption: Chesnok Red Hardneck garlic with upright, healthy foliage after rehydrating previously bone-dry soil.

journal.conditions: Mostly sunny with a high of 82°F dropping to 62°F overnight.
journal.observations: Chesnok Red Hardneck garlic displays strong upright leaves and healthy top growth. The probe reported 0 moisture due to a dry surface layer, but plant posture shows no drought stress. Soil is visibly dry on top but not depleted at root depth.
journal.actions: Water lightly today with 1/2 cup total for the garlic section to rehydrate the root zone without oversaturating. Continue filling probe holes after readings.
journal.next_steps: Expect moisture to rise into the moderate range by tomorrow morning. No fertilizer, pH adjustment, or treatments needed.

journal.next_steps: Recheck moisture tomorrow morning and continue monitoring leaf firmness and color.

journal.conditions: Sunny with a high of 84°F dropping to 63°F overnight.
journal.observations: Chesnok Red Hardneck garlic continues to show vigorous early top growth with tall, upright, green shoots and no signs of stress. Soil is fully saturated from recent watering, causing darker coloration and the elevated moisture reading. The extremely high pH reading of 10.17 is almost certainly a probe anomaly caused by contact with a lime pocket or oversaturated soil, as the plant shows no symptoms consistent with alkaline stress. Salt, EC, and fertility values are elevated due to recent water dissolving surface lime and minerals into solution, but remain non-harmful. Overall plant health remains excellent.
journal.actions: Do not adjust pH or fertilize. Allow soil to dry slightly before the next watering. Continue to provide full sun exposure.
journal.next_steps: Recheck moisture and pH tomorrow once the soil has partially dried. Continue monitoring shoot elongation and overall vigor.

photos.caption: Chesnok Red Hardneck garlic showing upright healthy shoots and vigorous early top growth under sunny conditions.

journal.conditions: Mostly cloudy with a high of 84°F dropping to 67°F overnight.
journal.observations: Chesnok Red Hardneck shows strong and healthy early top growth with upright green leaves and no signs of stress or nutrient deficiency. Soil moisture is extremely low today, consistent with the dry weather and container exposure, but the plant has not yet begun to wilt. pH continues to improve toward the ideal range after earlier lime applications.
journal.actions: Apply ½ cup of water distributed gently around the shoots. Do not fertilize or adjust soil chemistry today. Maintain normal sunlight exposure.
journal.next_steps: Recheck moisture tomorrow to confirm recovery into the ideal slightly-dry range. Continue monitoring shoot elongation and overall vigor as pH stabilizes.
follow_up: [11:04 AM] Applied ½ cup of water to rehydrate the Chesnok Red zone.

journal.conditions: Sunny with a high of 84°F dropping to 60°F overnight.
journal.observations: Chesnok Red Hardneck shows strong early top growth with upright green blades, firm stems, and no signs of stress. Soil remains slightly acidic but improving steadily after lime applications. Moisture is moderate and appropriate for garlic at this stage, and the plant shows healthy coloration with no yellowing or tip burn.
journal.actions: No watering required today. Leave soil chemistry unchanged and continue full sunlight exposure. Maintain normal monitoring.
journal.next_steps: Recheck moisture tomorrow to confirm it remains in the ideal slightly-dry range. Continue observing leaf elongation and overall vigor as pH stabilizes toward the target range.

journal.conditions: Mostly sunny with a high of 83°F dropping to 64°F overnight.
journal.observations: Chesnok Red Hardneck garlic shows strong, upright, vigorous green shoots with healthy coloration and no signs of stress. Soil surface appears normal with typical perlite and lime residue. Moisture level is very low, while pH and nutrient levels are ideal for garlic at this stage.
journal.actions: Apply light watering with approximately 1/2 cup distributed around the shoots. Do not fertilize. Leave pH and nutrients unchanged. Maintain full sunlight exposure.
journal.next_steps: Recheck moisture within 24 hours to ensure it returns to the optimal range. No cover needed tonight. Continue monitoring leaf growth and soil dryness.

photos.caption: Chesnok Red Hardneck garlic showing multiple healthy green shoots emerging with firm stems and proper spacing.

journal.conditions: Mostly sunny with a high around 82–85°F dropping to 64°F overnight.
journal.observations: Chesnok Red continues to show strong early growth with upright green shoots. One scallion is growing too close to a garlic sprout and could compete for space.
journal.actions: Apply garden lime today to help raise pH and gently relocate the single scallion that is crowding the Chesnok Red sprout.
journal.next_steps: Monitor shoot elongation over the next 24 hours and confirm that the relocated scallion and Chesnok sprout both resume normal growth.
journal.q_and_a_summary: Confirmed that only the one scallion crowding the Chesnok sprout needs to be relocated.
follow_up: [11:07 AM] Soil was watered unexpectedly; confirmed lime can still be applied safely to moist soil.
[3:04 PM] Applied lime evenly across the garlic and scallions planter; soil surface is dusted but not clumped.

Scallion planted too close to a Chesnok Red sprout before relocation.

journal.next_steps: Monitor sprout elongation over the next day and continue checking pH as lime works through the soil profile.

journal.conditions: Mostly sunny with a high of 81°F dropping to 61°F overnight.
journal.observations: Chesnok Red is already showing multiple strong early shoots with upright, green leaves and well-structured moist soil.
journal.actions: Apply a top-dress of dolomitic lime to continue raising the soil pH while keeping moisture steady.
journal.next_steps: Expect continued elongation of emerging blades over the next 48 hours and recheck pH after lime application begins to act.
journal.q_and_a_summary: Confirmed that the visible shoots on this side are true Chesnok Red garlic leaves.
